meta.name: Firing Line with Margaret Hoover
meta.description: Firing Line with Margaret Hoover maintains the character of the original, providing a platform that is diligent in its commitment to civility and the rigorous exchange of opinion. Interviews and debates will highlight leading lights from the left and right, complemented by archival footage from the original Firing Line to remind viewers of longstanding conservative and liberal arguments, where they've been disproved or reinforced over time.

videos.title: John Kasich
videos.overview: What does it mean to be a conservative in the age of Trump?

videos.title: Gretchen Carlson
videos.overview: The #MeToo movement, the resurrection of the ERA and the changing rules for Miss America.

videos.title: Paul Ryan
videos.overview: "Firing Line" explores the federal government's poverty agenda with Speaker Ryan.

videos.title: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez
videos.overview: Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez discusses her ideas and the future of democratic-socialism.

videos.title: Jeff Merkley
videos.overview: Progressive Senator Jeff Merkley joins this week on Firing Line.

videos.title: Randi Weingarten
videos.overview: The Supreme Court, teacher's unions, and improving education, with Randi Weingarten.

videos.title: Jordan Peterson
videos.overview: Dr. Jordan Peterson, accidental icon of the Conservative movement, joins this week.

videos.title: Ayaan Hirsi Ali
videos.overview: What does #metoo mean for the most vulnerable?

videos.title: DeRay Mckesson
videos.overview: DeRay Mckesson joins to discuss his new book.

videos.title: J.D. Greear
videos.overview: Pastor J.D. Greear speaks on faith, racism, and political support for Donald Trump.

videos.title: Neil deGrasse Tyson
videos.overview: Dr. Neil deGrasse Tyson joins to explore the stars, science, and human conflict.

videos.title: Reihan Salam
videos.overview: The Executive Editor of National Review joins to discuss conservative populism.

videos.title: Christine Lagarde
videos.overview: Christine Lagarde of the IMF joins to discuss women and economic inclusion.

videos.title: Lt. Col. Oliver North
videos.overview: Lt. Col. Oliver North, President of the National Rifle Association, joins.

videos.title: Leonard Leo
videos.overview: Leonard Leo joins to discuss the recent Supreme Court confirmation process.

videos.title: Ben Sasse
videos.overview: Republican Senator Ben Sasse of Nebraska joins to discuss loneliness and the Senate.

videos.title: Peter Navarro
videos.overview: Peter Navarro on trade wars, tariffs, and the threat from China.

videos.title: Jeff Weaver
videos.overview: Jeff Weaver, Bernie Sanders' former campaign manager, discusses the midterms.

videos.title: Max Boot
videos.overview: Historian Max Boot discusses President Donald Trump and the conservative movement.

videos.title: Episode 1
videos.overview: Firing Line's conversation with Mike Pence on the anniversary of the Jan. 6 attack.

videos.title: Episode 2
videos.overview: Reverend Al Sharpton discusses his evolution as a civil rights leader and the challenges and controversies he has faced. He weighs in on the progress of the movement and the power of Black voters.

videos.title: Episode 3
videos.overview: Pulitzer Prize winning-author and presidential biographer Jon Meacham discusses how today's leaders compare to their predecessors. Meacham, who has helped craft some of Biden's key speeches, weighs in on today's GOP and whether Biden will run again.

videos.title: Episode 4
videos.overview: Nancy Mace discusses the challenges of being a Republican who rejects the GOP's extremes and supports bipartisan solutions on abortion, cannabis and other issues. She weighs in on the classified documents investigations and debt ceiling.

videos.title: Episode 5
videos.overview: Media mogul Barry Diller discusses why he thinks Hollywood and the Oscars are irrelevant, the future of streaming, why he does not believe Alec Baldwin is responsible for the "Rust" set shooting, and what's ahead in politics.

videos.title: Episode 6
videos.overview: Brown economist Glenn Loury says affirmative action and reparations will not solve inequality and defends free speech on college campuses. Lourywho at 33 became Harvard's first Black tenured economics professordiscusses how his views have evolved.

videos.title: Episode 7
videos.overview: Brian O'HaraMinneapolis' first new police chief since George Floyd's deathdiscusses policing after the death of Tyre Nichols renewed calls for reform. He weighs in on racial disparities, qualified immunity, gun violence and elevated crime rates.

videos.title: Episode 8
videos.overview: Republican presidential candidate Nikki Haleythe first to challenge Trumpdiscusses serving as Trump's Ambassador to the UN, foreign policy threats to the US, and the future of the GOP. Haley's 2019 interview includes never-before-seen footage.

videos.title: Episode 9
videos.overview: Artist, activist and former political prisoner Ai Weiwei discusses resisting authoritarianism in China and beyond, whether the West can handle China's rising influence and his latest act of self-expression, his memoir.

videos.title: Episode 10
videos.overview: Rep. Mike Gallagher (R-WI)chair of the Select Committee on the Chinese Communist Partydiscusses how the US should respond to growing threats from the CCP. He discusses trade, the dangers of TikTok, and says the US should commit to defending Taiwan.

videos.title: Episode 11
videos.overview: Former Maryland Gov. Larry Hogan, the second Republican governor to be re-elected in Maryland and a vocal Trump critic, discusses why he won't challenge Trump for the GOP nomination, economic policy proposals, and the future of the GOP.

videos.title: Episode 12
videos.overview: Misty Copeland discusses becoming American Ballet Theatre's first Black principal dancer and the role her mentor, trailblazing Black ballerina Raven Wilkinson, played in her rise. Copeland weighs in on diversity in ballet, motherhood and her future.

videos.title: Episode 13
videos.overview: Supermodel and 1980s cover girl Paulina Porizkova discusses aging and ageism, harassment in modeling, her journey out of Communist Czechoslovakia, struggling with mental health, and the breakdown of her marriage to the late Cars' singer Ric Ocasek.

videos.title: Episode 14
videos.overview: Former federal prosecutor Andrew Weissmann talks about the 34 felony count indictment against Donald Trump, the prosecution's strengths and weaknesses and what to expect as Trump faces more criminal probes.

videos.title: Episode 15
videos.overview: Author and cultural critic Thomas Chatterton Williams explains why he thinks Americans need to unlearn traditional racial constructs in order to achieve equality. He also discusses the impact of culture wars and wokeness on contemporary politics.

videos.title: Episode 16
videos.overview: Rising Democratic star and political newcomer Gov. Wes Moore discusses overcoming tragedy to become a Rhodes Scholar, Army captain, bestselling author and Maryland's first Black governor. He details his plans for tackling poverty and crime.

videos.title: Tim Alberta
videos.overview: Tim Alberta discusses his book exploring evangelical Christians' loyalty to Donald Trump.

videos.title: Tony Gonzales
videos.overview: Tony Gonzales discusses the influx of migrants and his policy ideas addressing the crisis.

videos.title: Chris Sununu
videos.overview: New Hampshire GOP Gov. Chris Sununu explains why he supports Nikki Haley for president.

videos.title: David Petraeus
videos.overview: Ret. Gen. David Petraeus discusses the response to the Iran-backed militia's drone strike.

videos.title: Sheila Johnson
videos.overview: Entrepreneur and philanthropist Sheila Johnson discusses her memoir "Walk Through Fire".

videos.title: Jared Cohen
videos.overview: Jared Cohen discusses "Life After Power," his new book about post-presidential role.

videos.title: Liev Schreiber
videos.overview: Actor Liev Schreiber discusses the urgent need for humanitarian aid in Ukraine.

videos.title: Firing Line forum: Conservatives on Trump 2.0
videos.overview: At Hofstra University, Margaret Hoover leads a forum with two conservatives on the impact of a second Trump term. Amanda Carpenter warns of Trump's authoritarian impulses; Mike Gonzalez argues Trump would restore effective conservative policies.

videos.title: Firing Line forum: Examining The Electoral College
videos.overview: Margaret Hoover moderates a forum at Hofstra U. on whether the Electoral College should be

videos.title: Jonathan Haidt
